Header: The new Navy Commander assumes duties
Content: Newly appointed Navy Commander Vice Admiral Priyal de Silva assumed duties in his new portfolio. Priyal de Silva is the 23rd Navy Commander. He used to work as the Chief of Staff of Navy before being appointed as the Commander. Traditional custom to hand over of sword from the ex-Navy Commander Admiral Sirimewan Ranasinghe to New Commander was held at the Navy Headquarters. The new Navy Commander was also accorded with a guard of honor. He assumed duties amidst religious observances. The event was attended by a number of senior Navy officers.
